info.official_title: A Exploratory Study of Apatinib in Combination With S1 in Patients With Advanced Gastric Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety

identified_line.line: 1. Adult patients, aged between 18 and 75 years old;
2. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of ≤ 2;

criterions.exact_snippets: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of ≤ 2

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of ≤ 2

identified_line.line: 3. Histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic adenocarcinoma of gastric cancer(AGC) , including adenocarcinoma of the gastroesophageal junction ,one or more measurable or nonmeasurable evaluable lesions per RECIST 1.1;

criterions.exact_snippets: Histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic adenocarcinoma of gastric cancer(AGC)
Histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic adenocarcinoma of gastric cancer(AGC)
one or more measurable or nonmeasurable evaluable lesions per RECIST 1.1
one or more measurable or nonmeasurable evaluable lesions per RECIST 1.1
one or more measurable or nonmeasurable evaluable lesions per RECIST 1.1

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic adenocarcinoma of gastric cancer(AGC)
Histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic adenocarcinoma of gastric cancer(AGC)
one or more measurable or nonmeasurable evaluable lesions per RECIST 1.1
one or more measurable or nonmeasurable evaluable lesions per RECIST 1.1
one or more measurable or nonmeasurable evaluable lesions per RECIST 1.1

identified_line.line: 4. Failure or intolerance to at least one prior line of systemic chemotherapy regimen;

criterions.exact_snippets: Failure or intolerance to at least one prior line of systemic chemotherapy regimen
Failure or intolerance to at least one prior line of systemic chemotherapy regimen

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Failure or intolerance to at least one prior line of systemic chemotherapy regimen
Failure or intolerance to at least one prior line of systemic chemotherapy regimen

identified_line.line: 5. Adequate liver, renal, heart, and bone-marrow functions ( hemoglobin≥ 80g/L, platelets ≥ 100 × 10*9/L, neutrophil ≥1.5 × 10*9/L, total bilirubin ≤1.5 ×ULN, and serum transaminase≤2.5×ULN);

criterions.exact_snippets: Adequate liver, renal, heart, and bone-marrow functions
criterions.criterion: liver, renal, heart, and bone-marrow functions

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Adequate liver, renal, heart, and bone-marrow functions
and_criteria.criterion: liver, renal, heart, and bone-marrow functions

identified_line.line: Must have minimum age of 18 Years
Must have maximum age of 75 Years

1. Subjects with poor-controlled arterial hypertension (systolic blood pressure> 140 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure > 90 mm Hg) despite standard medical management; Coronary heart disease greater than ClassI; I-level arrhythmia (including QT interval prolongation, for man ≥ 450 ms, for woman ≥ 470 ms) together with Class I cardiac dysfunction;

criterions.exact_snippets: poor-controlled arterial hypertension (systolic blood pressure> 140 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure > 90 mm Hg)
poor-controlled arterial hypertension (systolic blood pressure> 140 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure > 90 mm Hg)
poor-controlled arterial hypertension (systolic blood pressure> 140 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure > 90 mm Hg)
Coronary heart disease greater than ClassI
I-level arrhythmia (including QT interval prolongation, for man ≥ 450 ms, for woman ≥ 470 ms)
I-level arrhythmia (including QT interval prolongation, for man ≥ 450 ms, for woman ≥ 470 ms)

and_criteria.exact_snippets: poor-controlled arterial hypertension (systolic blood pressure> 140 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure > 90 mm Hg)
poor-controlled arterial hypertension (systolic blood pressure> 140 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure > 90 mm Hg)
poor-controlled arterial hypertension (systolic blood pressure> 140 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure > 90 mm Hg)
Coronary heart disease greater than ClassI
I-level arrhythmia (including QT interval prolongation, for man ≥ 450 ms, for woman ≥ 470 ms)
I-level arrhythmia (including QT interval prolongation, for man ≥ 450 ms, for woman ≥ 470 ms)

identified_line.line: 3. Abnormal Coagulation (INR>1.5、APTT>1.5 UNL), with tendency of bleed;
4. Factors that could have an effect on oral medication (such as inability to swallow, chronic diarrhea and intestinal obstruction);
5. Previous treatment with VEGFR inhibitor (i.e. Apatinib, sorafenib, sunitinib);

criterions.exact_snippets: Previous treatment with VEGFR inhibitor (i.e. Apatinib, sorafenib, sunitinib)

not_criteria.exact_snippets: Previous treatment with VEGFR inhibitor (i.e. Apatinib, sorafenib, sunitinib)

identified_line.line: 6. With psychotropic drug abuse history and can't get rid of or mental disorder patients;

criterions.criterion: inability to cease psychotropic drug use

and_criteria.criterion: inability to cease psychotropic drug use

identified_line.line: 7. Associated with CNS (central nervous system) metastases;

criterions.exact_snippets: Associated with CNS (central nervous system) metastases

not_criteria.exact_snippets: Associated with CNS (central nervous system) metastases

identified_line.line: 2. Subjects with high gastrointestinal bleeding risk, including the following conditions: local active ulcer lesions with positive fecal occult blood test (++); history of black stool, or vomiting blood in the past 2 months;

criterions.exact_snippets: vomiting blood in the past 2 months

or_criteria.exact_snippets: vomiting blood in the past 2 months

identified_line.line: 10. Any other condition that might place the patient at undue risk or preclude a patient from completing the study.

criterions.exact_snippets: Any other condition that might place the patient at undue risk
condition that might ... preclude a patient from completing the study

condition that might ... preclude a patient from completing the study
